page.title: 09WILDLIFE AROUND NEYLAND 2
page.content: Near the pool is a colony of {Green-winged Orchids}which is doing well.Just beyond this is a colony of {Bastard Balm,}a local plant. The shrubs and trees on the slopes of the valley are the perfect environment for small birds such as,{Chiffchaff, Willow Warbler and {Blackcap. You can sometimes see{Shelduck standing on the mud of the Pill. This area is very good for butterflies because of the varied vegetation.You will often see the {Holly Blue,}which is found in shrubberies or on sunny edges of the woods.You should also see the{Dark {Green Fritillary,}and the{Purple {Hairstreak.}During the summer you may be lucky enough to see a{Painted Lady or{Clouded Yellow.
